title: Piasso
description: In four weeks, I developed Piasso, the first AI application that generates images from text in various languages, including Arabic, German, and Spanish. I replicated ChatGPT's functionalities using the DaVinci model, and included unique additions like a prompt library and search feature. Piasso is my first iOS app that gets approved on the App Store and is being used by thousands of active users.

title: SongGPT
description: SongGPT is one of my favorite side projects. I explored the potential of LLMs to generate music compositions. I learned a-lot about prompt engineering, how one can use machines to geneate artificial sounds and designing good user experiences. The app allows users to generate a song from any text such peom, lyrics or a quote or by selecting a color using the picker.

title: ChessGPT
description: I built a chess app to play against ChatGPT. I used prompt engineering techniques to represent the board in a text format and interpreted the ChatGPT's response as a move on the chessboard. I did the project out of curiosity to explore the limitations of LLMs in reasoning.

title: AskVisionOS
description: After Apple announced the Vision Pro, I got curious and watched all the videos about Vision OS. Then, I made a plugin using all that info from Apple to answer my own questions about Vision OS. Right now, it's just for my private use and I haven't released it yet.

title: biddz
description: biddz is a platform aimed at fostering a closer connection between music fans and artists. I transformed the founders idea into a product used by tens of thousands of users. I conceptualized, designed, and built the initial version while assembling a team to continue enhancing the product.

title: M.Sc. Computational Social Systems
description: The M.Sc. Computational Social Systems program is a unique interdisciplinary course at the intersection of data science and humanities. As a founding member, I was solely responsible for conceptualising, designing, and developing the website.

title: Chair for Computational Social Sciences and Humanities
description: The Chair for Computational Social Sciences and Humanities operates at the interface of data science and humanities, advancing research and education in these fields. As the 4th member to join the chair, I was responsible for the conceptualisation, design, and development of the website and also built various tools to automate the correction of student assignments.

title: IT for Kids
description: IT for Kids is a non-profit education partner for primary schools, promoting digital literacy and programming skills. Its mission is to enable all children to learn programming from primary school age. As a student at the University, I was responsible for conceptualising, designing, and building the IT for Kids website.

title: Zima
description: Zima is a browser extension enabling users to save and search their OpenAI chat transcripts.
